snippet: Although Chancellor Angela Merkel is against introducing a nationwide minimum wage, it may be the price she has to pay to build the stable government she has promised voters.
abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel's conservatives meet for second round of preliminary talks with center-left Social Democrats, who are demanding a base wage of 8.50 euros an hour for workers across Germany; issue has emerged as central sticking point the two sides must overcome if they are to proceed to the next step of formally trying to build a coalition.
lead_paragraph: Although Chancellor Angela Merkel is against introducing a nationwide minimum wage, it may be the price she has to pay to build the stable government she has promised voters.

headline.main: To Form German Coalition, Merkel’s Party May Need to Support a Minimum Wage
headline.print_headline: To Form German Coalition, Merkel’s Party May Need to Support a Minimum Wage
